title: Ronnie Ortiz-Magro 'won't face felony charges' following domestic violence incident with Jen Harley
text:
He was tazered and handcuffed after an altercation with his baby mama Jen Harley earlier this month.

But now it appears that Ronnie Ortiz-Magro will not face any felony charges stemming from the incident, TMZ reported on Wednesday.

According to the outlet, the Los Angeles County District Attorney has declined to file charges against the Jersey Shore reality star either for domestic violence or for kidnapping.

Off the hook: He was tazered and handcuffed after an altercation with baby mama Jen Harley. But it appears Ronnie Ortiz-Magro will not face any felony charges stemming from the incident

The case now goes to the LA City Attorney who will decide whether or not to purse misdemeanor charges against the 33-year-old.

Ronnie was arrested by LAPD officers on October 4 at a home he was sharing with his on/off partner Jen following a fight.

According to court documents obtained by TMZ, Ronnie allegedly 'slapped and punched Jen' before chasing her around the home with a knife while he was carrying their toddler, Ariana Sky.

The reality star also allegedly told Jen that 'he was going to kill her.'

Volatile: Ronnie was arrested by LAPD officers on October 4 at a rental he shared with on/off partner Jen following a fight but TMZ reports the LA County D.A. has declined to charge him

Took action: TMZ reported that police 'broke down the door' to the Airbnb rental because they were worried the couple's 18-month-old daughter Ariana was in danger

TMZ reported that police 'broke down the door' to the Airbnb rental they were living in because they were worried the 18-month-old little girl was in danger.

Ronnie reportedly refused to 'go peacefully' and officers used a Taser to take him into custody on suspicion of kidnapping.

Jen was seen in surveillance footage running with Ariana during the fight and knocking on the neighbors door before placing the tot on the ground.

Ronnie was ordered to stay 100 yards away from Jen and Ariana following the altercation but that order was dismissed on October 11 after Jen failed to show up in court.

Ronnie took to social media to share video and photos with his little girl at Disneyland on October 12.

Jen was seen partying in Las Vegas with Farrah Abraham on October 17.

On October 17, Jen, center, attended a Las Vegas event with Farrah Abraham and Larissa Lima. A temporary restraining order against Ronnie lapsed after she failed to appear in court in LA
description: According to TMZ, the Los Angeles County District Attorney has declined to file charges against the Jersey Shore reality star either for domestic violence or for kidnapping.
